string.text: {=si_ar_aserai_culture_description}The Aserai are the inhabitants of the Nahasa desert, a mixture of nomadic bedouin and settled oasis farmers. They are famous for their horsemanship and their knowledge of the learning of many lands, especially medicine, gained from lying on some of the continent's most lucrative trade routes. Each clan is fiercely proud of its lineage and often jealous of the others, but when united by a charismatic leader, they become a major force in the south.

{=si_ar_battania_culture_description}The Battanians still remember the olden days when the woods stretched across northern Calradia, and the Empire and its cities had yet to violate their sanctity. The fierce warriors remain loyal to their traditional ways. They paint their faces when going to battle and even their noblemen prefer to fight on foot while using great axes and two-handed swords with deadly efficiency.

{=si_ar_empire_culture_description}The Calradian Empire is in crisis. Political rivalries have torn the land in three, with claimants attempting to seize power for themselves, whilst enemies close on all sides, carving new kingdoms from imperial territory. They are technologically more advanced than their neighbors and their mastery of engineering is not just evident in their aqueducts, beautiful architecture and massive city walls. It also makes them experts in siege warfare.

{=si_ar_khuzait_culture_description}The tribes of the Iltanlar live a largely nomadic life, riding from their settlements in the Devseg Plateau to raid and trade with neighbouring lands. Despite having permanent camps, they still retain many aspects of their nomadic life, including their affinity with horses. They are masters of mounted archery, shooting and then galloping out of reach.

{=si_ar_sturgia_culture_description}Sturgians are the descendants of the tribes of northern Calradia. As the Calradian Empire expanded into their cold forests, they found a ready market for the luxurious furs of woodland animals whom they traditionally hunted and trapped. For centuries, Sturgian boyars and chieftains have vied for pre-eminence with the help of Nord mercenaries who migrated into their realm. They are good hunters and wanderers, travelling far in search of opportunities both for trade and for plunder.

{=si_ar_vlandia_culture_description}The Vlandians are the descendants of mercenaries from the west who have served the Calradian Empire for many centuries. Famed across the continent for their mounted warriors, who fight with spears and lances on horseback, they served loyally whilst secretly yearning for a time when they could break from imperial rule and govern themselves. In recent years, they have formed an independent kingdom led by a caste of warlike nobles.

{=si_ar_darshi_culture_description}The Darshi are the inhabitants of a vast empire to the east and south of Calradia, ruled over by an ancient lineage of Padishahs. Whilst in Calradia they are referred to as a single group, the Darshi are in fact a series of smaller satrapies, each with their own unique culture and leaders. In battle, they are known for their robust infantry and powerful shock cavalry.

{=si_ar_empire_n_culture_description}The Calradian Empire is in crisis. Political rivalries have torn the land in three, with claimants attempting to seize power for themselves, whilst enemies close on all sides, carving new kingdoms from imperial territory. They are technologically more advanced than their neighbors and their mastery of engineering is not just evident in their aqueducts, beautiful architecture and massive city walls. It also makes them experts in siege warfare.

{=si_ar_empire_w_culture_description}The Calradian Empire is in crisis. Political rivalries have torn the land in three, with claimants attempting to seize power for themselves, whilst enemies close on all sides, carving new kingdoms from imperial territory. They are technologically more advanced than their neighbors and their mastery of engineering is not just evident in their aqueducts, beautiful architecture and massive city walls. It also makes them experts in siege warfare.

{=si_ar_kannic_culture_description}The Kannic people are the ancient inhabitants of coastal regions of the western Nahasa desert. From their capital at Quyaz, they once ruled over a vast empire. However, they were conquered centuries ago by the Calradian Empire, forming the southernmost of its provinces. Recently independent, they now vie for control of the Nahasa, sending their legions against both their former Calradian rulers and Aserai neighbours.

{=si_ar_vakken_culture_description}The Vakken are the original inhabitants of northern Calradia. Conquered many years ago by the Calradian Empire, they have modelled much of their society in the imperial fashion, founding colonies along the northern coasts of Lake Laconis, and warring with the neighbouring Sturgians. In battle, their legions are not unlike those of the Empire, wielding swords and shields, and throwing pointed javelins.
{=si_ar_khuzait_comment_noble_introduces_self_and_clan}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK}, of the {CLAN_NAME}. Our clan has loyally served the Iltanlar for generations.

{=si_ar_khuzait_boasting_comment_noble_introduces_self_and_clan}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK}, of the {CLAN_NAME}. I am sure you have heard the name of our clan in the epics of the steppe. We carry the name of one the 12 sons of the great she-wolf, mother of the Iltanlar.

{=si_ar_sturgia_comment_noble_introduces_self_and_clan}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK}, of the {CLAN_NAME}. Our ancestors were among those who came from the far north to take the Sturgian denars and swear oathes to defend these lands, and we have held true to that oath.
{=si_ar_vlandia_comment_noble_introduces_self_and_clan}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK}, of the {CLAN_NAME}. Our family has served the Vlandian people for generations.
{=si_ar_vlandia_boasting_comment_noble_introduces_self_and_clan}I am {CONVERSATION_CHARACTER.LINK}, of the {CLAN_NAME}, one of the most illustrious families in the annals of the Vlandian people.

{=YayEAKaI}Perhaps you have not heard of the Jawwal. Well, when you cross the desert, far from oasis and spring, in a land that others scorn, with thorns fit only for goats and camels, then you are in our domain.

{=si_ar_beni_zilal_comment_special_clan_intro}The Beni Zilal are the keepers of the secret. We haunt your footsteps. We watch from the shadows. We are the whispers in a crowded room. We are a knife in the darkness. Make foes of us at your peril.

{=si_ar_lochanians_comment_special_clan_intro}Snows fall, ice crushes, axes bite and ships sail. Our homes may be lost to time, hooves and a cold wind, but we endure. Swords and axes will cut deep, whilst our warriors still have the strength to wield them!

{=si_ar_hawlans_comment_special_clan_intro}You will not have heard of the names of our people, nor of our homeland. We are the remnants of a proud and ancient people, sold into servitude and now reborn again in this strange land. Freedom shall be ours.

{=si_ar_chosen_of_the_sky_comment_special_clan_intro}We are the chosen of the great lord Aizur - son of the she-wolf - he who mounted the horse of night and rides across the sky with his pack of wolves. Look upon our radiance and despair!

{=si_ar_karakhuzaits_comment_special_clan_intro}Maybe you have not heard of the Karakhuzait? We do not venture much into the sewn lands, the corrupt lands. We bow to no Khan. We sew no grain. We keep to the old ways, out amid the great grasses.

{=si_ar_silver_dragon_company_comment_special_clan_intro}No, you have not heard of our homeland, but no matter. Far have we come, and many lords have we served, though not without a price. If your purse is fat enough, mayhap we can come to an agreement.

{=si_ar_kohi_rohini_comment_special_clan_intro}We may be far from our mountain home, but no matter. The mountain men of the Kohi Rohini shall defeat you, or your foes, wherever battle is joined. The only thing determining victory, or defeat, is the pile of gold at our feet!

{=si_ar_ghilman_comment_special_clan_intro}Perhaps one day we shall see each other on a battlefield. You shall know the Kolemen by the splendor of our steeds and the shimmer of our steel. If we are on your side, you may rejoice. If we are your enemy, you may save yourself a great deal of trouble by running away before the fighting starts!

{=si_ar_ethawians_comment_special_clan_intro}You may think us savages, but beware! We are not mere warriors of forest and savannah. Our lands, though far off, are not unlike to yours, and every man and woman among us is more than a match for your kind!

{=si_ar_lakepike_comment_special_clan_intro}They may call us 'Lake Rats', but we prefer to be known as the 'Free People of the Marshes'. No so-called 'King' or 'Chieftain' can make us bow our heads and scrape our knees! Know that, and we can probably get along fine. Probably ...

{=si_ar_skolderbroda_comment_special_clan_intro}You may know of the Skolderbroda. On the battlefield, we are second to none. We expect to be paid according to our worth, and that is not cheap. But, if we take your coin, you will have our oath to honor the terms of the contract, to our death if necessary.

{=si_ar_seax_comment_special_clan_intro}Our home may be the sea, but don’t let that fool you. We are proud Nords to a man, and our seaxes cut just as deep be the fight on rolling waves or rolling hills. You would be wise to avoid fighting against us, or better still, pay us to fight for you!

{=si_ar_hidden_hand_comment_special_clan_intro}When you walk these roads, my friend, know that nothing escapes the notice of the Hidden Hand. Emperors, kings or lords may come and go, but we will remain.

{=si_ar_chandions_champions_comment_special_clan_intro}We were once the champions of the sand. Now, we fight for coin. Few can afford us, but rest assured, we always make good on the investments of those who can.

{=si_ar_embers_of_flame_comment_special_clan_intro}We seek nothing less than the destruction of the tyrannical Calradian Empire and its so-called ‘Emperor’. Then, our master Cypegos may return to this world to retake his throne.

{=si_ar_yachios_free_company_comment_special_clan_intro}We are the Free Company of the city of Yachios. Though far from the shifting sands of our homeland, our bright steel cuts just as sharp. We shall take your gold and fight at your side, but if you face us, then beware!

{=si_ar_legion_of_the_betrayed_comment_special_clan_intro}We are the Nineth Legion - the 'Jackals of Jalmarys'. Once, we served the Calradian Empire, but now we have been reborn, hardened in the fires of battle and taught the one true lesson of this world. It is gold, not titles or lines of kinship, that make a man. So … hurry up and pay!

{=si_ar_saleas_sisters_comment_special_clan_intro}The spirit of Salea fights on through us. The sands of the arena are far behind us, but the fight that is ours continues to the ends of the world. Men would do well to fear our blades, for the arena has made us a match for any in a fight!

{=si_ar_eleftheroi_comment_special_clan_intro}You may have heard of us - the Eleftheroi. Our fathers were thieves and runaways and troublemakers - we won't deny it. We came here because they didn't want us anywhere else. But I'll tell you this - if the Calradian Empire survives, it'll be thanks to men like us, doing the hard, bloody work out here in the wild fields, not those who sleep comfortably in their beds!

{=si_ar_forest_people_comment_special_clan_intro}We welcome strangers into our lands. The woods are wide, and there is game to be hunted and food to be gathered, enough for all. But there are some who come here to steal from us, to enslave us, or to tax us. Every spring, the bodies of those thieves are discovered in the thaw.

{=si_ar_vezha_valkyries_comment_special_clan_intro}Behold the Valkyries of the blood mother Vezha! See our spear points glimmer, and our axes slice through the frigid air? We need no excuse to end you. If our mistress demands blood, we will pay. The only choice is if that blood is yours, or someone else’s!

{=si_ar_ircara_comment_special_clan_intro}We are the original holders of the woods, rivers and plains. Our people came before Calradios and his kin ever stepped foot on this land, and we shall endure long after they, or any others, are gone.

{=si_ar_wolfskins_comment_special_clan_intro}Perhaps you've heard of the Wolfskins, traveller. We are beasts. Know that so long as we eat no cooked meat, wear only furs, and sleep under no roof, we cannot be touched by the laws of men. So, tread carefully with us.

{=si_ar_druids_comment_special_clan_intro}Well met. We are the ‘Seers of Oak, Spruce and Birch’, the ‘Knowers of the Otherworld’, the ‘Druids of Ailta Druin’. Know that we have foretold this meeting, and be welcome. The spirits of the Otherworld smile upon us.

{=si_ar_dryatics_comment_special_clan_intro}The men of the mountain do not suffer fools lightly, nor those with honeyed tongues. Know that whilst we are far from our homes, our ancestors are looking on, stranger. Speak! We shall listen, if for a time.

{=si_ar_guardians_comment_special_clan_intro}Once, our lands stretched from the Dryatic Mountains to the lands of the Battanians. Whilst our brothers may content themselves with fighting for the Calradian Empire, we prefer the sight of gold and the taste of battle!

{=si_ar_company_of_the_boar_comment_special_clan_intro}If you're ever looking for brave warriors, friend, you should think about hiring the Company of the Boar. The stoutest lads in Vlandia flock to our banner. Hire us, because if you don't, your enemy might.

{=si_ar_brotherhood_of_woods_comment_special_clan_intro}The common folk of these lands need someone to look after them. That's where our Brotherhood comes in. You'll hear us called bandits or robbers. Don't believe a word of it.

{=si_ar_swadians_comment_special_clan_intro}The Swadian Plains may be our home, but we shall fight anywhere across this vast continent, if the coin is good enough. From the steppe of the east to the snows of the north, to the sands of the south, people fear the sound of our hooves!

{=si_ar_biscan_exiles_comment_special_clan_intro}Our home on the coast may no longer be ours, but no matter. The saddle and the war camp has always been more of a home to us than any painted hall or lavish villa. So, are you hiring us?

{=si_ar_lysians_comment_special_clan_intro}Our ancestors once claimed all the seas and oceans. We know the waves, the tides, the eddies. They are not dissimilar to the battlefield, as we see it. In fighting or sailing, if the gold is good, we shall take it.

{=si_ar_geroianys_free_company_comment_special_clan_intro}We Geroians live by a simple motto - ‘gold conquers all’. As warriors, we consider ourselves merchants of battle. Our wares are the defeated enemies we lay at your feet, their gold taken as plunder and their commonfolk sold as slaves. Remember this, and pay us well, and we shall be friends.

{=si_ar_companions_of_theudaris_comment_special_clan_intro}We wish for a return to the old ways, where the swords and the saddle were the only home we Massa knew. Now, our kin prefer fields of wheat to fields of battle. Warm halls and the safe, cozy fireside to the glory and thrill of combat. I’ll tell you this - there is greater strength among the Massa than you know. Tread lightly!
